title: Counselling Services
description: Counselling and Psychological Services is a team of professionals dedicated to supporting the personal and  interpersonal functioning of our diverse university community.

title: MATES Peer Mentors
description: MATES (Mentor Assistance Through Educational Support) is a student outreach program which seeks to promote personal life balance, self confidence, resiliency and academic support for UW students who are currently having academic, social, physical, emotional, cultural, and / or psychological difficulties.
hours: Needles Hall Expansion Office: Monday to Friday: 9am - 4pm, Health Services Centre Office: Monday, Tuesday, Friday:  9:00am - 4:00pm Wednesday & Thursday:  9:00am - 7:00pm

title: Centre for Mental Health Research
description: The Centre for Mental Health Research (CMHR) offers accessible, effective mental health services for people of all ages in the Region of Waterloo while facilitating cutting-edge research on the development, persistence and treatment of mental health problems and providing comprehensive clinical training in our state-of-the-art facility.
location: Room 1401, ground floor, Psychology, Anthropology, Sociology (PAS) Building

title: Health Services
description: Health Services provides primary medical care for all registered University of Waterloo students. Our health professionals work to promote a safe, healthy environment for our students.
location: Take the bridge to Health Services, located across from the Student Life Centre.
phone: 519-888-4096 to schedule an appointment, 1-866-797-0000  for free 24/7 advice from a health professional

title: Crisis Service of Waterloo Region
description: The Canadian Mental Health Association Waterloo Wellington Dufferin Crisis Services provides prevention, assessment, intervention and resolution services for urgent crisis situations in Waterloo Region.
location: 67 King Street E, Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) Waterloo Wellington Dufferin, Kitchener, Ontario

title: Delton Glebe Counselling Centre
description: The Delton Glebe Counselling Centre is a not-for-profit multi-faith counselling agency committed to strengthening emotional and spiritual well-being.

title: Distress Line
description: The Distress Centre provides confidential supportive listening to individuals in Waterloo, Wellington and Dufferin.

title: Good2Talk
description: A free, confidential and anonymous helpline providing professional counselling and information and referrals for mental health, addictions and well-being to post-secondary students in Ontario.

title: Here24/7
description: Here 24/7 is your front door to the addictions, mental health and crisis services provided by 12 agencies across Waterloo - Wellington - Dufferin.

title: K-W Counselling Services
description: KW Counselling Services is a multi-service agency providing individual, family, group and outreach supports to the community.

title: Student Success Office
description: Provide and facilitates strategic student support for academic and personal success.
hours: Monday, Wednesday and Friday, 8:30am - 4:30pm. Tuesday and Thursday, 8:30am - 6:00pm

title: Telehealth Ontario
description: Telehealth Ontario is a free, confidential service you can call to get health advice or information.
